current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the publication by the Secretary of Human
		  Services of physical activity guidelines for Americans.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Physical Activity Guidelines for
			 Americans Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of
			 Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish a report highlighting
			 the best practices and continuing issues in the physical activity arena, which
			 may focus on a particular group, subsection, or other division of the general
			 public or a particular issue relating to the physical activity of
			 Americans.

quote.#tail:
. Each such report shall contain
			 physical activity information and guidelines for the general public, and shall
			 be promoted by each Federal agency in carrying out any Federal health program.
			 Not later than 5 years after the publication of the first such report, and
			 every 10 years thereafter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be based on the preponderance of
			 the scientific and medical knowledge which is current at the time the report is
			 prepared, and shall include guidelines for identified population subgroups,
			 including children, if the preponderance of scientific and medical knowledge
			 indicates those subgroups require different levels of physical activity.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans Act/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
The information and guidelines contained in
			 each report required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for a 60-day review period.

text.#text:
Any Federal agency that proposes to issue
			 any physical activity guidance for the general population or identified
			 population subgroups shall submit the text of such guidance to the

shall review and approve or disapprove such
			 guidance to assure that the guidance either is consistent with the
. If after such 60-day review period the

has not

			 such guidance may be issued by the agency. If the

disapproves such
			 guidance, it shall be returned to the agency. If the

finds that such

disapproves such guidance as inconsistent with the

			 is based on medical or new scientific knowledge which is determined to be valid

and so notifies the proposing agency, such agency shall
			 follow the procedures set forth in this subsection before disseminating such
			 proposal to the public in final form. If after such 60-day period, the

text.#text:
During the 60-day review period established
			 in

publish a notice in the Federal Register of
			 the availability of the full text of the proposal and the preamble of such
			 proposal which shall explain the basis and purpose for the proposed physical
			 activity guidance;

provide in such notice for a public comment
			 period of 30 days; and

make available for public inspection and
			 copying during normal business hours any comment received by the agency during
			 such comment period.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may approve for dissemination by the
			 proposing agency a final version of such physical activity guidance along with
			 an explanation of the basis and purpose for the final guidance which addresses
			 significant and substantive comments as determined by the proposing
			 agency.

text.#text:
After review of comments received during
			 the comment period, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be announced in a notice
			 published in the Federal Register, before public dissemination along with an
			 address where copies may be obtained.

term.#tail:
does not include any rule or regulation
			 issued by a Federal agency.
term.#text:
physical activity guidance
			 for the general population

term.#tail:
shall include, but not be limited to, groups based on factors
			 such as age, sex, race, or physical disability.

text.#text:
This section does
			 not place any limitations on—

the conduct or support of any scientific or
			 medical research by any Federal agency; or

the presentation of any scientific or
			 medical findings or the exchange or review of scientific or medical information
			 by any Federal agency.
